attributes.action: Make it law that holiday insurance can not be ageist or pre medical conditions
attributes.background: Make it law holiday insurance companies can not be ageist and discriminate health issues by charging extortionate premiums. Once over 65 yrs of age premiums increase dramatically without just cause. Medical conditions pre or existing are charged regardless, as they may be cured or controlled etc.
attributes.additional_details:
People are living longer and are more active in later life and retirement.
The government urge the older generation to become more active, this in turn makes health issues less with a faster recovery rate.
With this in mind why should insurance companies be allowed to discriminate against the older generation to create extra revenue.
I would like the government to make a law that stops discrimination against the elderly. Some are refused cover and have to travel without insurance cover.

attributes.action: Build a bypass around Sedbury to reduce traffic and help development.
attributes.background: The lowering of the Severn Bridge Toll represents a huge oppurtunity for growth in Monmouthshire, Forest of Dean and South East Wales. However the road infrastructure is inadequate. The A48 is already suffering from congestion and poor air quality.
attributes.additional_details:
With the addition of new housing estates in both Monmouthshire and Forest of Dean the current proposals fall unacceptably short in facilitating growth.

A new route is required, around Sedbury on the English side and Chepstow on the Welsh side, to avoid stifling sustainable economic development.

A sister petition has been lodged with the Welsh National Assembly regarding the Welsh side of the bypass. We urge parliament not to let this issue fall prey to cross border buck passing.

attributes.action: Stop sending foreign aid to countries that have space programmes
attributes.background: UK currently sends 0.7% of GPA as foreign aid to some countries which have space programmes such as India and China when our own public services are at breaking point. This should be reduced and the savings put into our own NHS and other public services. Countries receiving should be developing ones
attributes.additional_details:
British ambassador in China is currently inviting the elderly in China to apply for a grant from the foreign aid fund of 1.3 billion, a country that spends billions on aspace programme and has one of the largest acconamy in the world.
UK sends millions to India and Pakistan every year in foreign aid when they also have space programmes.
At a time of austerity this money should be spent on public services here in the UK

attributes.action: Make buyers committed to the purchase of a property after making an offer
attributes.background: Many people have had an offer on their house withdrawn just prior to the exchange of contracts. This has resulted in them losing the house which they wish to purchase but still incurring solicitors/search fees. The law should be changed to protect the seller in the same way that it is in Scotland
attributes.additional_details: The offer on our house was withdrawn the day before exchange of contracts was due to take place. We had made an offer on another property, had searches done and were ready to exchange at the same time (back to back sale/purchase). When our sale fell through this house went back on the market and sold to another buyer leaving us with almost £2000 solicitor fees still to pay.

attributes.action: Grant Right to Work for Asylum Seekers waiting  3+years for Home Office decision
attributes.background:
For more than a decade, the UK’s policies to restrict asylum seekers’ rights to work in the UK have attracted criticism from NGOs, trade unions, churches and some Parliamentarians, amongst others. 
Calls for change have tended to focus on:
attributes.additional_details:
Advantages of extending asylum seekers’ rights to work include that it would:
1. Benefit the UK economy and reduce the costs to the taxpayer of supporting asylum seekers
2. Alleviate some of the difficulties that asylum seekers can face during the asylum determination process, such as social and economic exclusion, de-skilling, low self- esteem and poor mental health, and improve asylum seekers’ integration and employment prospects in the event of a positive asylum decision
3. Reduce asylum seekers’ vulnerability to exploitation through working illegally

attributes.action: Reverse changes to Vehicle Excise Duty Tax
attributes.background: On the 1st April 2017, new Tax Laws are to be introduced that will introduce a flat rate for all non-Zero Emission to £140 per year and an additional £310 'premium' for all vehicles with a new price of £40,000+.
attributes.additional_details:
Though it may reduce the rate on high emission vehicles, there is no benefit to the taxpayer unless the vehicle produces more than 266g/km due to the hefty first year rate.

For example a Lexus IS 300h Hybrid at the current rate costs £40 over 3 years. Under the new scheme £560 would be the tax over 3 years.

Also this affects many Zero-Emission Cars such as the Tesla Model S. Currently they would pay £0 but as the value is over £40,000 when new, owners would have to pay £310 per year for an EV.

attributes.action: £369 million proposed for Buckingham Palace to be used to fund Social Housing
attributes.background:
The Queen has been given a 66% payrise that will facilitate a £369 million refurbishment. 
Funnily enough the countless homeless on the Queen's own doorstep will not have enough points or be able to bid for any of the vacant rooms. Give this money to build social housing for the homeless.

attributes.action: UK residents without right to vote in general elections to be income tax exempt
attributes.background: No taxation without representation. There are millions of people living, working, and paying taxes in the UK, but with no right to participate to national politics with their vote. Parliament and Government do not represent them, and should not dispose of the tax revenues raised through their work.
attributes.additional_details:
The numbers say that foreigners positively contribute to the UK revenue. The last Governments have pursued austerity policies, and have not invested this additional income to fund health, education, and housing systems. Instead, foreigners are have been blamed to put pressure on these systems.
The Government is not accountable to foreigners because they have no right to vote. This is against the spirit of John Hampden, English great patriot, who first claimed "no taxation without representation"

attributes.action: The government to help victims of domestic violence
attributes.background: social services need further training with dealing with women of domestic violence they are quick enough to take children away from women but they are not trained to support women in getting out of these relationship or helping women to be reunited with their children
attributes.additional_details: All cases involving social services and courts should have a expert witness available to explain to everyone the effects and complications of domestically violent relationships also to help everyone understand it. Too many women are just deemed as bad mothers for not being able to escape domestically abusive relationship when there is no support even from social services

attributes.action: Stop Home Office sending LGBT asylum seekers back to Afghanistan
attributes.background:
New government guidelines state that gay Afghans seeking asylum can be deported to Afghanistan and must pretend to be straight.
This contradicts UN guidelines which state LGBT people should not be required to change/conceal their identity to avoid persecution.
We ask the government to repeal this.
attributes.additional_details:
Guardian: Deported gay Afghans told to ‘pretend to be straight’ (February 2017) https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2017/feb/25/afghanistan-gay-asylum-seekers-home-office-illegal-homosexuality

Home Office: Country Policy and Information Note (January 2017) Afghanistan: Sexual orientation and
gender identity https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/584025/Afghanistan_-_SOGI_-_CPIN_-__January_2017_.pdf

attributes.action: Amend the Equality Act to require Hotels to have Part M compliant guest room.
attributes.background: Disabled persons find it almost impossible to find suitable accommodation in hotels.  The Public Sector is required to make reasonable adjustments to physical features in line with Part M design standards whereas the Private Sector simply has a non-specific a duty to make reasonable adjustments.
attributes.additional_details: In a 2015 debate in the House of Lords it was stated that thousands of hotels around the country were not meeting the needs of disabled persons. It is common practice to provide grab rails and signage but circulation space, access to walk-in showers and raised beds are sadly overlooked.  This year I was forced by these circumstances to miss a significant part of my son's wedding because a hotel had, in their opinion, undertaken the reasonable adjustments to make their facility fully accessible.

attributes.action: Encourage motorcycle manufacturers take more responsible for motorcycle theft.
attributes.background: it is not easy to lock up a motorcycle on the street or your driveway however if there were more security features built into the bike, it could provide the additional protection required to do so.
attributes.additional_details:
Many bikes are only able to be locked through the wheels which can be removed relatively easily. If there was a way to secure the frame on more bikes it would make it a lot more difficult to steal. 
Manufacturers could also install trackers and alarms at the construction stage.
Motorcycles can help reduce congestion in cities and have lower emissions than most 4 wheeled vehicles.
The problem is too many people are being put off riding a motorcycle because of the risk of it being stolen.

attributes.action: We call on Her Majesty's Government to suspend all HMPS contracts with Sodexo.
attributes.background: We believe that the Prison Service is woefully underfunded and that perceived cost savings of sub contracting of services to private contractors, such as Sodexo, has undermined the HMPS' objectives of rehabilitation of prisoners to enable them to be returned to society as law abiding citizens

attributes.action: Stop the British Army disbanding the world's most famous Motorcycle Display Team
attributes.background: The team, the oldest and most famous motorcycle display team in the world, the White Helmets has made a considerable contribution over the years to the Army’s Community Engagement activities performing spectacular feats. The Army had decided to cut back and disband this Proud national treasure.
attributes.additional_details: Help show your support for this impressive British treasure that is internationally renowned and is a jewel in British military history by signing this petition. We should be proud and show our support for the forces and it's ability to engage with the people of the world and the white helmets are apart of the way we showcase our Armed Forces.

attributes.action: Make profiting from lying about a military career a criminal offence
attributes.background:
No military or civilian person should be able to make financial gains from lying about or exaggerating military service.

Including but not limited to being paid as an after-dinner speaker (to discuss their military service) or receiving royalties from so-called 'real life event' style book sales.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently several individuals in the public eye who are making a healthy profit by selling books and after-dinner speeches about their so-called military service.

Unless able to be verified (possible by a number of simple checks), they should be prosecuted, & any wrongful financial gain donated to a relevant military charity or similar organisation (for example the Royal British Legion).

attributes.action: Make St.George's Day a national holiday, countries celebrate their Saint's Day
attributes.background: Now we are going to become an independent country, let's make us great again, and come together to celebrate our Saint George in style, and have a national holiday to celebrate every year, even if we swap it for , say , MAYDAY , bring it forward slightly, or add this in.

attributes.action: Welcome president Trump and discuss trade , security, immigration and friendship
attributes.background: I want to be able to welcome the new president and ensure we keep the special relationship going for many more years
attributes.additional_details: The recent backlash for no reason

attributes.action: Force Local Authorities to allocate a proportion of housing to pet owners.
attributes.background: People are being forced to make the decision between giving up their pets or being homeless.  For some people their pet is the only family they have, and the animal is often vital for helping with mental health issues. People end up living on the streets rather than giving up their beloved friend.
attributes.additional_details: In every town in Britain there are people living on the streets, for no other reason than their local authority is refusing to home them. They are given the impossible choice of giving up their pet or being homeless. They are vulnerable people, and are being discriminated against for sharing love and companionship with a pet. It would be detrimental for them to lose their pets, and would put additional strain on the mental health service. They are at risk of serious harm or death on the street.

attributes.action: To limit fireworks to organised, licenced events before 9 at night.
attributes.background: I feel that nervous animals, the elderly and young children suffer when fireworks are set off at all hours on any day. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 1  o clock in the morning last night for example.
attributes.additional_details: One of my dogs who had had dental surgery began to bleed again due to her being stressed..repeatedly. People who have to get up early,  young children and the elderly cannot sleep. I'm a nurse who has witnessed elderly dementia patients think they're back in world war 2 because the loud bangs remind them of bombs going off. At least if fireworks were limited to set days and times we could prepare for it better. You can't give animals calming medication continually just in case.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to produce and use products made of non-recyclable plastic
attributes.background: We need to stop thinking that plastic waste is being dealt with to the degree at which it is advertised. We do not need non-recyclable plastic, and this is evident by the amount we only use once - then throw away every day.
attributes.additional_details: A large amount of plastics marked 'recyclable' are not recycled in the UK (mostly mixed plastics) and are instead sent abroad to be disposed of. As a result of this, we need to open far more facilities capable of processing and recycling mixed plastics. Our use of non-recyclable plastic is unsustainable, irresponsible and unnecessary.

attributes.action: Gelatine in our food must be marked what animal it is from and in bold writing.
attributes.background: Gelatine is in our food, sweets, pharmaceutical products and many other products. If a product contains Gelatine, it must be written what animal it is from and it must be in bold writing. Food products that contain Gelatine must be clearly marked in bold writing Not suitable for vegetarians.

attributes.action: Use the Tampon Tax to subsidise sanitary products for girls of school age.
attributes.background: Research indicates that Girls of school age  from low income families regularly miss school due to their menstruation.								                      				                              Low income families currently receive free school meals - why cant this be the case for young girls and sanitary wear?

attributes.action: Make Transfer Deadline Day a bank holiday.
attributes.background: This is a big event for every football fan and should be considered a bank holiday.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to pay carers from the start to end of their shifts
attributes.background: As a carer I could start my shift at 7am and finish at 2pm but may only be paid for 4 hours work because the Councils pay care companies for the minutes they are in with a client. If a client cancels their call I won't get paid. I love care work but no one can be expected to work for free.
attributes.additional_details: As a carer I am expected to start my shift at say 7am and be available until 2pm but I will only get paid for the minutes I am in with a client plus minimum travel time. Not only are carers on zero hours contracts they are also paid minimum wage and do not get paid for a full shift even though they are available to work. Would we expect a fireman to only get paid when he is putting a fire out or a receptionist to only be paid when they type a letter? Carers need to know what they will earn.

attributes.action: Allow local councils to keep 100% of Right to Buy receipts.
attributes.background: Under current regulations, councils in England are entitled to pay for 30% of the cost of replacing social housing with funds from the sale of Right to Buy properties. This means that, for every £1 of receipts they keep, they need to raise another £2.30 through loans.
attributes.additional_details:
The sale of social housing through the Right to Buy scheme could have been a good way for local councils to raise much-needed cash to build more homes. Unfortunately, the majority of it has ended up with central government as councils can't find the amounts of money needed to keep the receipts.
We are all well aware of the damage a shortage of available social housing has done and this change would allow the increase in home building that we so desperately need.

attributes.action: Stop funding charities that pay executives and employees  excessive wages
attributes.background:
Charities are funded & given huge sums of money from the government with out any conditions & this money is rarely used for the purpose it was intended
instead it is mostly put in the pockets of its employees in the form of extortionate wages employee wages including executives should be capped
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2550648/Fury-234-000-salary-boss-Save-Children-Charity-chiefs-huge-wages-reined-say-MPs.html

attributes.action: Licence and regulate nail technicians, hairdressers and beauticians.
attributes.background: People in the hair and beauty industry are not always qualified or have only done 1 day of training which isnt enough, these uneducated people are working on the public with no knowlage and insurance. They are also causing harm and damage to the public aswell as illegal workers being exploited.
attributes.additional_details: Not being educated in this industry, working on the public and having illness, disabilities, young children and exploitation of illegal workers could cause serious harm to people. Also the people who are working without the correct qualification IS NOT able to obtain any form of insurance meaning they are not covered incase of accident or damage.

attributes.action: Debate whether filibustering is acceptable in a modern democracy.
attributes.background:
There have been examples recently of filibustering. Here an individual takes it upon themselves to talk a bill out of debate.
This is an affront to democracy, as one individual should not have the power to decide what is or is not deemed acceptable to vote on.

attributes.action: Remove all subsidies for fossil fuels, use them to subsidise renewable energy.
attributes.background: It's impossible for the government to simultaneously state their commitment to combating climate change and subsidise fossil fuels to the extent that they do. The amount of money spent on renewable energy is meanwhile decreasing. Spending more on renewable's is the only way to show real commitment.
attributes.additional_details: Subsidies for fossil fuels which approach £6 billion a year are being given to companies which generate profits in the hundreds of millions. That money is far better used to subsidies to production and implementation of renewable energies or to subsidies the household energy bills. There is an estimated 26.7 million households in the UK, the money could be used to decrease the annual energy bill by £224. Stop giving to the rich, start giving to the people.

attributes.action: Ban the sale to, and possession by, civilians of combat daggers and bayonets.
attributes.background: These weapons' sole function is to kill - they can have no place in civilian ownership and yet are legally available to any UK adult. This is a legal loophole which could be easily closed.
attributes.additional_details: I am a secondary school teacher and work in the Security industry.

attributes.action: Don’t trigger Article 50 – just leave
attributes.background: Under international law and under Article 50 (1) itself, only notice to leave is necessary.
attributes.additional_details: if Article 50(2) is ‘triggered’ it implies that the UK government accepts that the EU will decide the conditions of UK’s withdrawal. This has serious consequences. An arbitrary two-year negotiation window; a supreme agency problem between negotiating parties. All the while we will be contributing approximately £40bn gross, or £20bn net, to the European project.

attributes.action: Clearly define to Donald Trump what behaviour would end our special relationship
attributes.background: We the undersigned demand a debate in parliament to clearly define, both to the UK and US governments, what behaviour by the new US President-elect in office would result in the British people demanding the end of the UK-US special relationship.
attributes.additional_details: The UK-US special relationship has been built on shared values, objectives & defence over many years. We the undersigned want the special relationship to continue but it can only be special if those values, objectives & defence are still shared. Donald Trump has been democratically elected president of the US, having made remarks during his campaign that many in the UK do not agree with. It is not our place to interfere with who is US president, but we can decide how we respond to the choice.

attributes.action: Immediate ban on unregulated Private Parking companies from accessing DVLA data.
attributes.background:
Citizens Advice recently reported a dramatic rise in people seeking help about penalties for parking on private land – trebling from 16,300 to 50,000.
They should be forced to install parking barriers not Aprn cameras.
attributes.additional_details:
The injustice of heavy fines for small parking errors.
Victim’s mental wellbeing is never a concern.
They've mastered to make life difficult for drivers.
A group of private car parking companies threatened to take moneysaving expert to court an attempt to stop them from telling consumers their legitimate rights.
According to the DVLA, private parking operators have requested  details of drivers more than three million times in the last year, which has increased from 2.4 million the year before.

attributes.action: Yorkshire to secede from the U.K. and become part of Scotland.
attributes.background: We have more in common with our Northern brothers and sisters than southern Tory counties. We wish to join Scotland and remain part of the E.U. and have free prescriptions and university education.

attributes.action: Ban schools from making rules that disallow specific hair colours and piercings.
attributes.background: Students are always told to show their individuality through creativity. How do we do this when schools ban certain hair colours and styles, and facial piercings? "Reasoning" is that it is a distraction from learning, but this isn't so when teachers don't follow the same principle they set.
attributes.additional_details:
Students can be given the same punishment for having (e.g.) pink hair, as someone who has assaulted another pupil - this is something that needs to be rectified.

For example, in one secondary school, a student was threatened with a day's worth of internal exclusion for having a strip of pink hair. The same punishment is given to people in the school who assault others, bully others, and are just genuinely badly behaved...how are these two actions justifiably punishable through the same means?

attributes.action: Overlook parents income for getting a student loan
attributes.background: When applying for a student loan you have to give your parents financial information even if they do not support you financially, meaning a lot of people get given the minimum for student finance and then have to struggle for the year. Change this so that it looks at your own financial situation.
attributes.additional_details: Student finance bases your loan on how much your parents make, but just because they make that doesn't mean they give it to you. A lot of people support themselves but cannot be given more help due to parents. Change the rules on applying to just look at the students income and financial situation.

attributes.action: Discuss measures to increase notifiable disease vaccination uptake.
attributes.background: Most childhood diseases are preventable. The NHS strongly encourages parents to vaccinate via education. However, a small minority of parents refuse. With the number of susceptible children increasing, these diseases are returning, putting lives at risk. New tactics are required to increase uptake.
attributes.additional_details:
Other governments have intervened to increase uptake:
Australia - withholding childcare payments until vaccinated (tinyurl.com/jrk6ll5)
USA - specific vaccination requirements before attending school (tinyurl.com/zswec56)

Discussing and adopting similar approaches in addition to education should increase uptake. Exemptions on health grounds should also be considered.

MMR severe reactions: <1 in 1 million
Measles deaths: before 1980 - 2,600,000 per year, 2015 <135,000.
(tinyurl.com/y8szy8e)

attributes.action: Government should underwrite car insurance for young first time drivers.
attributes.background: For young drivers, the average cost of getting on the road has increased by 18% over the last 5 years to almost £6,800. Car insurance makes up a third of the total. This makes it prohibitively expensive for many average income families.
attributes.additional_details: I propose that the government should explore a government backed insurance scheme for young drivers there by offering a fair opportunity to all regardless of family income

attributes.action: We want the UK Government refuse to pay any exit payment to the EU on leaving
attributes.background: We are told that the UK could face a very large bill from the EU after Brexit. I have no doubt that the people of the UK will have to foot the bill in the way of some tax increase or other. The people of the UK should never have to pay to leave the EU, as we where never asked if we wanted to join.

attributes.action: For the UK not to join the USA in any war conflict.
attributes.background: The USA are a highly militarised country, with an aggressive, ignorant and misleading president. Their actions in war, would be influenced by Donald J Trump and therefore would be misleading for the UK, And not co operating in war with the USA would increase trade chance and foreign relations.
attributes.additional_details: Donald J Trump has already made very extremist remarks, regarding banning Muslims from entering his "Fortress" and exclaimed things which may provoke other countries. Which clearly hint he is not in great interest of making relations to other foreign countries. He would not be in best conclusion of making such a relation with the UK, and therefore we should not join him in his far right wing foreign policy and Milatary actions which he may declare later in his presidential run.

attributes.action: Make the government provide the funding that the NHS and social care need
attributes.background: The NHS and social care under the conservatives has taken huge cuts. This has put huge strain on the NHS with the Red Cross deeming it a "humanitarian crisis". People are dying waiting on trolleys in hospital for beds that are not available.
attributes.additional_details: People are waiting up to 12 hours to be seen in A&E, when the target is four hours. Old people spend weeks in hospital beds as there is no social care to treat them at home. People's lives are at risk and the conservative government are doing nothing about it. I hearby call that PM Theresa May and health secretary Jeremy Hunt provide the funding that is desperately needed. This demands action and it needs it now. We cannot put people's lives at risk, this is not acceptable. They must act now.

attributes.action: Inculde more safety elements in the driving test towards motorcycle awareness
attributes.background: too often cars drift around their lanes freely instead of staying straight, especially when moving slowly, this makes filtering through traffic Dangerous! Car drivers pay very little attention to motorcyclist. While I was learning to drive a car, not one thing was ever mentioned about a motorbike!
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hit by 2 cars within 2 years and neither of them were my fault, this could be easily avoided if people where taught about motorcyclists while learning to drive! I have witnessed more times than I care to count, cars use their full acceleration in traffic to move from a slow moving lane to a faster moving lane without thought of a motorcycle. They do this as they are not taught about about motorcyclist! This WILL save lives.

Thanks you for reading and please sign & share

attributes.action: Take military action against the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's Government.
attributes.background: 3 years ago, Parliament rejected a Gov. motion to take action against the Syrian Gov., after receiving evidence of the use of Chemical weapons against the Syrian people. We ask Parliament to reconsider its position following more recent reports of war crimes, including summary killings of civilians.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the UN confirmed that the Syrian Government had used chemical weapons against the Syrian people. In recent days there have been increased concerns that the Syrian army and their military supporters are committing both humanitarian and war crimes, including the massacring of families in cold blood. We urge Parliament to approve military action, in order to help in relieving Syrian civilians of their plight, and to deter the Syrian Government from committing such crimes against them.

attributes.action: Change the Postal Voting System
attributes.background:
The postal voting system is wide open to abuse
There have been numerous examples of postal voter fraud in our country.
We believe that postal votes should only be available to our Armed Forces, people who are ill or who are on holiday
Also make photo ID at polling stations mandatory

attributes.action: Screening and training for mobility scooters especially for class 3
attributes.background: There are 300,000 mobility users in England and Wales. There were 208 accidents in 2014-2015, 46 serious injuries, and 9 deaths. Class 3 mobility scooters can use the road up to 8mph, need TAX and at present, only voluntary insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
Training is needed for cars and motorcycles that use the highways but no training is needed for mobility scooters. AM Hefin David and AM Julie Morgan are in agreement that training should be given. Compulsory training will help reduce accident rates and make the users more confident and independent which will help with well-being. Statistics are being looked into to make insurance mandatory but not training. ROSPA say training should be given but not necessary!

Screening should also be done by a doctor or medical professional before buying a mobility scooter. This will ensure that people have the physical and mental capacity required to safely use a scooter, such as adequate vision.

attributes.action: Make it government policy to aim to end extreme global poverty
attributes.background: More than 1.3 billion people live in extreme poverty on less than £1.01 a day and according to UNICEF, 22,000 children die each day due to poverty. This is something that is hugely unacceptable and can be easily changed by leading nations' involvement, including the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
- 800 million people do not have enough to eat and 21,000 people die each day due to starvation.
- Almost 900 million people in the world do not have access to safe drinking water.
- Out of 2 billion children in the world, 1 billion are living in poverty.

If this becomes government policy, the UK can tackle the major issues within global poverty, and persuade other nations to contribute. It is possible to end world poverty but this depends on the individuals with the power and wealth to do so.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 and reprieve threatened communities in East/West Midlands and Yorkshire
attributes.background: Consider cheaper alternatives to HS2. For example; improve East/West links and invest in digital connectivity to serve the "Northern Powerhouse"; re-classify first-class carriages; research the "Metro" idea and re-schedule timetables to boost capacity; complete proposed electrification projects.

attributes.action: Change the HWC to make it an offence to park opposite/within 10m of a junction.
attributes.background: The HWC states (rule 243) DO NOT stop or park opposite or within 10 metres of a junction, except in an authorised parking space, however as this is just an advisory it is ignored by many drivers across the UK. This should be changed to MUST NOT meaning tickets can be issued by traffic wardens.

attributes.action: Dangerous dogs that have re offended need to be euthanised immediately
attributes.background: Our fifteen year old daughter and our sixteen week old puppy were subjected to a vicious unprovoked attack near our home. The dog that carried out the attack has a previous history of this! The dog has not been destroyed and will only be if the court rule this! The dog is free to attack again
attributes.additional_details: During the attack our daughter suffered bite injuries to her elbow. This has caused her lots of pain and discomfort due to the nerves in that area. Had she not had a coat on it would have been a more significant injury and potentially limb threatening! Our puppy received surgery to save her badly broken leg and will require on going medical attention. The emotional scars will take years to heal for both of them! Our seven year old daughter who witnessed the attack is also deeply affected.

attributes.action: Allow the people a referendum on the potential abolition of the 'House of Lords'
attributes.background:
The EU referendum gave the UK electorate the chance to say no to 'unelected' & ‘out of touch with reality’ officialdom in Brussels.
Sadly we have the same ‘unelected’ & ‘out of touch with reality’ membership of a club, numbering around 800, collectively known as the ‘House of Lords’.
attributes.additional_details:
At vast annual expense to the tax payer it is believed that he net operating costs of the House of Lords in 2013-4 were £93.1m, this is approximately equivalent to £118k per Peer.

I would strongly recommend that the annual total cost of the House of Lords that would be saved by its abolition, should be given in its entirety to our Local Council Authorities to help towards the increasing costs of providing compassionate care and adequate supervision for our increasingly elderly population.
